column4: Alright so it totally seems like I already asked this question but it's slightly altered now: Why can't I find the ATI Accelerated Graphics Driver?  It appears I need to download it in order to install Catalyst.
It's not on there.  It's completely blank.
that suggests that your card isn't supported by fglrx any more
Well, the reason I feel like that isn't the case is on the BinaryDriverHowTo for ATI it mentions the x300 as being supported and the first step of installing it is enabling said driver.
What's the open source driver/where do I get it?
It says I have the newest xserver-xorg-video-ati version already.
and that is not ok for you?
catalyst is *not* for the open source driver!!!
Erm... I knew that.  I guess I have a lot less of an idea what I'm doing than you think :P  Where can I find installation instructions for that?
I don't know I just want a driver for my video card!  Any driver will do >_>
I have an x1300, I use the open source driver - didn't really miss catalyst
I have an x300- are those similar?
no idea, I assumed yours was older, but... - listen to bucky please
